data.title: Global Accessibility Hubs
data.meta_description: The accessibility hubs are to ensure visitors, guests, and employees are aware of constraints and accessible provisions in our office spaces.
data.text:
UberWAV is an option on the Uber app which connects wheelchair users with accessible transport. The service provides reliable, on-demand transport for wheelchair users.

NOTE: UberWAV can take around 20 minutes for a car to arrive.

G7 Access offers van-type, accessible taxi service throughout Paris. This service is available on-demand or with advance scheduling by phone, website, or app.

- For more information, visit the G7 Access Taxi website.

- The region offers two direct airport shuttles, one from each airport, to/from Central Paris.

Getting to the Paris Salesforce Tower from the Roissy Charles de Gaulle Airport (CDG):

- Take the Roissybus — Drop-off/pick-up is located at Paris-Opéra (corner of Rue Scribe and Rue Auber).

- Getting to the Paris Salesforce Tower from Orly Airport (ORY):

- Take the Orlybus — Drop-off/pick-up is located at Place Denfert-Rochereau (corner of Rue Froidevaux and Avenue Denfert-Rochereau).

NOTE: Both shuttles will require you to transfer to another mode of travel after arriving at the drop-off location in Paris to get to the Salesforce Tower. Use the travel planner on the RATP website prior to arriving to find your preferred route.
